metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23639 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
crossbeam-utils provides atomics, synchronization primitives, scoped threads, and other utilities for concurrent programming in Rust. crossbeam-utils prior to version 0.8.7 incorrectly assumed that the alignment of `{i,u}64` was always the same as `Atomic{I,U}64`. However, the alignment of `{i,u}64` on a 32-bit target can be smaller than `Atomic{I,U}64`. This can cause unaligned memory accesses and data race. Crates using `fetch_*` methods with `AtomicCell<{i,u}64>` are affected by this issue. 32-bit targets without `Atomic{I,U}64` and 64-bit targets are not affected by this issue. This has been fixed in crossbeam-utils 0.8.7. There are currently no known workarounds.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-rsvg-2.0 - 2.48.9-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
librsvg2-2 - 2.48.9-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
librsvg2-bin - 2.48.9-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
librsvg2-common - 2.48.9-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

libstd-rust-1.59 - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
rust-all - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
rust-clippy - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
rust-gdb - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
rust-lldb - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
rust-src - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
rustc - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
rustfmt - 1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine sbeattie> rustc 1.58.1+dfsg1~ubuntu1-0ubuntu1/jammy fixed this in the 0.8.5 embedded code copy, but not the 0.7.2 copy. mdeslaur> librsvg doesn't appear to use AtomicCell

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
librsvg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.48.9-1ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
rustc package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.59.0+dfsg1~ubuntu1~llvm-1~ubuntu1~20.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
